frame.name: Cause_temperature_change
frame.definition:
<def-root>In this frame, an <fen>Agent</fen> changes the temperature of an <fen>Item</fen>. A <fen>Temperature_goal</fen> can specify the desired temperature. A <fen>Temperature_change</fen> can also be indicated. The <fen>Temperature_start</fen> indicates the initial temperature.
<ex><fex name="Agent">Margaret Anne</fex> <t>chilled</t> <fex name="Item">the salad</fex> <fex name="Temperature_goal">to 30 degrees</fex>.</ex> <ex><t>Heat</t> <fex name="Item">the water</fex> <fex name="Temperature_change">30 degrees</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Agent
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Agent</fen> performs the intentional act which changes the temperature of the <fen>Item</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Agt">Ryan</fex> <t>reheated</t> the pasta in the microwave.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Instrument</fen> with which the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the temperature of the <fen>Item</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Item
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Item</fen> undergoes the temperature change.
<ex>Ryan <t>reheated</t> <fex name="Item">the pasta</fex> in the microwave.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Temperature_goal
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Temperature_goal</fen> is the temperature to which the <fen>Agent</fen> is heating or cooling the <fen>Item</fen>.
<ex><t>Heat</t> the syrup <fex name="Temperature_goal">to 180 degrees</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Temperature_change
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Temperature_change</fen> is the amount of difference between the intial and goal temperatures.</def-root>

FE.name: Temperature_start
FE.definition:
<def-root><fen>Temperature_start</fen> is the initial temperature of the <fen>Item</fen>.
<ex><t>Heat</t> the sugar water mixture <fex name="Temperature_start">from room temperature</fex> until it reaches 180 degrees.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Manner</fen> in which the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the temperature of the <fen>Item</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Means</fen> by which the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the temperature of the <fen>Item</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Place
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the temperature of the <fen>Item</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Purpose</fen> for which the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the temperature of the <fen>Item</fen> and what the <fen>Agent</fen> hopes to accomplish.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the temperature of the <fen>Item</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Result
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Result</fen> is the resultant state of the <fen>Agent</fen> changing the temperature of the <fen>Item</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Cause
FE.definition: <def-root>An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that changes the temperature. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s. <ex><fex name="Cause">The sun</fex> <t>warmed</t> the house.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Duration
FE.definition:
<def-root>The length of time for which the <fen>Agent</fen> changes the temperature of the <fen>Item</fen>.
<ex><t>Refrigerate</t> the cookie dough <fex name="Dur">for an hour</fex> before baking.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Subregion
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Subregion</fen> describes which part of a larger whole is being affected.
<ex>The mousse was <t>chilled</t> <fex name="Subregion">around the edges</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Container
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Container</fen> that holds the <fen>Item</fen> whose temperature is being changed.
<ex><t>Heat</t> the potatoes <fex name="Container">in a medium-sized pan</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describing the <fen>Agent</fen> or <fen>Item</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Hot_Cold_source
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Hot_Cold_source</fen> is the source of the heat or coolness.
<ex>We <t>chilled</t> the drinks <fex name="Hot_Cold_source">on ice</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Circumstances</fen> at which the temperature change occurs.
<ex>Bill <t>cooled</t> the jello <fex name="Circumstances">at room temperature</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition:
<def-root>The degree to which the <fen>Item</fen> approaches (an implicit) <fen>Temperature_goal</fen>, which is often construed to be the ambient temperature.
<ex>You'll probably have to wait a while to <t>warm</t> your legs <t>up</t> <fex name="Degr">completely</fex>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: warm.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause an entity to become higher in termperature by subjecting it to a heat source

lexUnit.name: cool.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to become at a fairly low temperature

lexUnit.name: refrigerate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause the temperature of an entity to become lower by placing it in a refrigerator

lexUnit.name: heat up.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause the temperature of an object to rise

lexUnit.name: cool down.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: cause to become at a fairly low temperature

lexUnit.name: warm up.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to make at a higher temperature

lexUnit.name: reheat.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to cause an entity to become warm again by subjecting it to a heat source

lexUnit.name: overheat.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to become too hot
